intro: Lecanophora jarae, commonly known as the Jarae morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant typically grows as a vine, with heart-shaped leaves and waxy, pale blue or purple petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some areas.
